subject: Business
description: Royal Mail warns that competition from rivals could hurt its future revenues as it reports a rise in annual operating profits to £671m.
title: Royal Mail warns on future profits

subject: Business
description: Property website Zoopla announces plans to float its shares on the London Stock Exchange, but retailer Fat Face cancels plans for a public listing.
title: Zoopla plans stock market listing

subject: Business
description: The first plastic banknotes in Britain will be in use next year when two million £5 notes are issued by Clydesdale Bank branches.
title: Plastic £5 note 'first in Britain'

subject: Business
description: The UK economy grew by 0.8% in the first three months of 2014, official figures show, confirming initial estimates.
title: UK economic growth confirmed at 0.8%

subject: Business
description: Oil giant BP appeals to the US Supreme Court over a ruling regarding how businesses must be compensated in the wake of the 2010 Gulf of Mexico oil disaster.
title: BP in appeal to US Supreme Court

subject: Business
description: Russia's President Vladimir Putin agrees a multi-billion dollar, 30-year gas deal with China at a summit between the two in Shanghai.
title: China and Russia sign huge gas deal

subject: Business
description: Tesco says it is to stop selling sweets and chocolates at all its checkouts in an effort to help customers make healthier choices.
title: Tesco to move sweets from checkouts

subject: Business
description: The US Federal Reserve began discussing how to raise interest rates, which have been held at 0% since 2008, but caution a rate raise is not imminent, minutes reveal.
title: US Fed weighs rate rise options

subject: Business
description: McDonald's vacates its headquarters as hundreds of workers and labour organisers protest and demand the fast-food giant increase the minimum wage paid to workers.
title: McDonald's headquarters shut down

subject: Business
description: Chinese online retailer JD.com raises $1.8bn in its US share sale, valuing the company at more $25bn according to underwriters Bank of America and UBS Investment Bank.
title: China's JD.com to debut on Nasdaq

subject: Business
description: UK retail sales rose by 6.9% in April compared with the same month a year earlier, new official figures show.
title: Retail sales growth at 10 year high

subject: Business
description: UK mortgage lending in April was 36% higher than a year ago, a lenders' group says, as a major bank moves to cool the housing market in London.
title: Mortgage lending leap fuels debate

subject: Business
description: Another AstraZeneca shareholder asks the pharmaceutical firm's board to reconsider its rejection of Pfizer's £69bn takeover proposal.
title: Astra investor urges Pfizer rethink

subject: Business
description: Members of eBay are being made to change their passwords after a cyber-attack compromised a database containing user information.
title: eBay makes users change passwords

subject: Business
description: General Motors announces the recall of another 218,000 older small cars in the US over a fire safety fear - a day after a 2.6 million global recall
title: GM recalls more cars on safety fears

subject: Business
description: The Scottish referendum is the "foremost issue for businesses" in the UK, the head of the business lobby group, the CBI, will say later.
title: CBI warns on Scottish referendum

subject: Business
description: US jewellery firm Tiffany reports a 50% year-on-year jump in profits for the three months to the end of April.
title: Tiffany profits jump 50% to $126m

subject: Business
description: The French train operator SNCF has discovered that 2,000 new trains it ordered at a cost of 15bn euros are too wide for many regional platforms.
title: French embarrassment over rail error

subject: Business
description: TV presenter Gabby Logan admits having been part of the same tax avoidance scheme as Gary Barlow, and vows to pay back any money she owes.
title: Gabby Logan vows to pay back tax

subject: Business
description: A third of students in England, who pay up to £9,000 in tuition fees, say their degree course is poor or very poor value for money, a study indicates.
title: Degree courses 'not value for money'

subject: Business
description: A letter is being sent out to single parents in England, Scotland and Wales urging them to agree child maintenance amicably or face charges.
title: Child maintenance 'agree or pay' call

subject: Business
description: Big Six supplier SSE reports a 9.6% rise in pre-tax profits to £1.5bn for the year to April, but says it is a challenging time for energy firms.
title: SSE posts a 9.6% rise in profits

subject: Business
description: Higher fares for flights and ferries helped to push the rate of inflation up in April, the first increase in the rate for 10 months.
title: UK inflation rate rises to 1.8%

subject: Business
description: Ed Miliband says a Labour government would set a statutory minimum wage target linked to average earnings, as he sets out plans to tackle low pay.
title: Miliband sets out minimum wage plans

subject: Business
description: UK house prices rose by 8% in the year to the end of March, official figures show, as the prime minister says he will consider changes to Help to Buy.
title: UK house prices 'up 8% in a year'

subject: Business
description: Global expansion is a challenge for companies. How can chief executives steer their firm's international expansion effectively?
title: How to drive firms to global success

subject: Business
description: How Sophia Amoruso went from petty theft to founding Nasty Gal, one of the fastest growing e-commerce sites in the US with over $100m (£60m) in revenue.
title: 'Shoplifting saved my life'

subject: Business
description: A look at the enduring rivalry between Vienna's two famous producers of the sachertorte chocolate cake.
title: Vienna's chocolate cake war

subject: Business
description: No problems are reported with the re-launched sale of Commonwealth Games tickets after last week's attempt was suspended amid technical issues.
title: 'No hitches' with Games ticket sales

subject: Business
description: MSPs are to examine claims that contracts given to youth football players in Scotland are unfair and could breach human rights regulations.
title: Youth football contracts probed

description: Luxury German carmaker BMW signs a four-year extension to its sponsorship of the European Tour golf series.
